abstract: Our June sales were our lowest since August 2008. I convinced myself that something had shifted in the outside world and there simply weren’t as many shoppers looking to buy high-end conference tables.
snippet: Our June sales were our lowest since August 2008. I convinced myself that something had shifted in the outside world and there simply weren’t as many shoppers looking to buy high-end conference tables.
lead_paragraph: As I said in Wednesday’s post, my first theory of why my sales were dropping last spring was that the world was going down the drain again, just as it had in 2008. Or maybe my corporate clients were feeling bullish and decided to invest in hiring instead of burning profits on fancy conference tables. I could find plenty of evidence for either idea in the papers. At any rate, I convinced myself that something had shifted in the outside world and there simply weren’t as many shoppers looking for tables.

headline.main: My AdWords Debacle: Waiting for a Miracle
